{{convert|1545|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} (GT) | weight = {{convert|1825-2090|kg|lb|0|abbr=on}} }} The '''Kia EV6''' is a [[Battery electric vehicle|battery electric]] [[compact crossover SUV]] produced by [[Kia]].{{Cite web|date=2021-03-08|title=Kia adopts ‘EV’ nameplate nomenclature as it teases EV6|url=https://www.autonews.com/cars-concepts/kia-adopts-ev-nameplate-nomenclature-it-teases-ev6|access-date=2021-03-09|website=Automotive News|language=en}}{{Cite web|date=2021-03-08|title=Here's a sneaky glimpse of the Kia EV6 electric car|url=https://www.topgear.com/car-news/electric/heres-sneaky-glimpse-kia-ev6-electric-car|access-date=2021-03-09|website=Top Gear|language=en}} Introduced in March 2021, it is the first Kia dedicated electric vehicle, and the first model developed on the [[Hyundai Electric Global Modular Platform|Electric Global Modular Platform (E-GMP)]] similar to the [[Hyundai Ioniq 5]].{{Cite web|title=Kia EV6 teaser gives us our first look at the E-GMP-based electric car|url=https://www.autoblog.com/2021/03/08/kia-ev6-electric-car-egmp-platform-teaser/|access-date=2021-03-09|website=Autoblog|language=en}}{{Cite web|last=Herald|first=The Korea|date=2021-03-30|title=Kia fully unveils EV6, the first EV launch since rebranding|url=http://www.koreaherald.com/view.php?ud=20210330000920|access-date=2021-04-01|website=www.koreaherald.com|language=en}} It is also the first model to be named under the new nomenclature designated for a line of Kia electric cars, which will range from EV1 to EV9.{{Cite web|last=Hoffman|first=Connor|date=2021-03-09|title=2022 Kia EV6 Will Be First of 11 Promised Electric Cars|url=https://www.caranddriver.com/news/a35781520/2022-kia-ev6-confirmed/|access-date=2021-07-02|website=Car and Driver|language=en-US}} The EV6 is the 2022 [[European Car of the Year]]. == Overview == The EV6 was released on 2 August 2021 after a set of pictures were revealed on 15 March 2021.{{Cite news|title=Kia starts selling the EV6, an all-electric SUV|work=《koreajoongangdaily》|url=https://koreajoongangdaily.joins.com/2021/08/02/business/industry/kia-ev6-tesla/20210802175500531.html|access-date=August 2, 2021}}{{Cite news|title=Kia's EV6 electric vehicle boasts distinctive crossover-inspired design|work=《Aju Business Daily》|url=https://www.ajudaily.com/view/20210315111616504|access-date=March 15, 2021}}{{Cite news|title=Kia Unveils EV6, Its First All-electric Vehicle|work=《Businesskorea》|url=http://www.businesskorea.co.kr/news/articleView.html?idxno=63593|access-date=March 31, 2021}} Developed under the codename ''CV'',{{Cite web|title=Kia CV Electric Crossover Officially Confirmed For March Debut|url=https://www.motor1.com/news/486924/kia-cv-electric-crossover-debut/|access-date=2021-04-29|website=Motor1.com|language=en}} it is the first Kia model based on the [[Hyundai Electric Global Modular Platform|E-GMP electric car platform]]. The GT model is claimed to have a {{convert|0|–|100|km/h|mph|abbr=on}} time in 3.5 seconds, rapid 800V charging capability and vehicle-to-load function.{{Cite news|title=Kia adds blistering GT to EV6 lineup|work=《Autonews》|url=https://www.autonews.com/cars-concepts/kia-adds-blistering-gt-ev6-lineup|access-date=March 30, 2021}} It features a panoramic curved display panel inside, which opens up more space while a controller for transition between infotainment and HVAC below the navigation screen and touch buttons for using heated seat as well as steering wheel further enhance driver usability. The EV6's boot space is {{cvt|520|L|cuft|sigfig=3}} (VDA standard) and it can be increased up to {{cvt|1,300|L|cuft|sigfig=3}} when the rear seats are folded. The crossover is claimed to be furnished with sustainable materials for its door pocket, crash pad, mood lighting, garnish and Nappa leather seats. It also has [[augmented reality]] [[Automotive head-up display|head-up display]], 360° camera option, remote controlled parking, along with safety technologies including [[Lane centering|Lane Follow Assist]], Highway Driving Assist 2 ([[semi-autonomous]] [[adaptive cruise control]]) including auto lane changing, [[Autonomous Emergency Braking|AEB]] [[collision avoidance system|collision avoidance]], [[Automatic parking|remote smart parking assist]] and Safe Exit Assist.{{Cite web|title=New 2021 Kia EV6: UK prices and specifications confirmed|url=https://www.autoexpress.co.uk/kia/ev6|access-date=2021-04-12|website=Auto Express|language=en}} File:Kia EV6 Automesse Ludwigsburg 2022 1X7A5931.jpg|Kia EV6 Air Long Range File:2022 Kia EV6 Air Long Range 2WD (Rear).jpg|2022 EV6 Air Long Range (UK) File:Kia EV6 GT-Line Leonberg 2022 1X7A0531.jpg|Interior === GT-Line === File:Kia EV6 GT-Line CV Moonscape Gray Matte (1) (cropped).jpg|EV6 GT Line File:Kia EV6 GT-Line IMG 5867.jpg|EV6 GT Line === EV6 GT === The EV6 GT was released on October 4, 2022; it is a high-performance version of the EV6, supposed to go from zero to 100 km/h in 3.5 seconds.{{Cite news |date= |title=Kia launches high-performance electric model EV6 GT |work=yonhap news agency |url=https://en.yna.co.kr/view/AEN20221004001600320 |access-date=October 4, 2022}} The EV6 GT features four-piston calipers with a monoblock front wheel that improves size/performance over the base model, and a body strengthened with front strut ring and rear luggage floor reinforcement bars. In addition, rack-driven power steering and variable gear ratio technology optimize steering response to speed. As for the design, GT-specific 21-inch wheels and neon-colored calipers stand out, and a diffuser is applied at the bottom of the rear bumper to optimize the air flow under the car to help accelerate. The interior is equipped with a D-cut steering wheel, GT Mode buttons, seats, and other neon colors. In addition, GT Mode with RBM function that maximizes the use of regenerative braking and Kia's first Drift Mode are applied.
